title: Tech sans used on Si Begg album covers and artwork
content:
sorry for the awful images. couldnt find anything larger...any ideas? i'm stumped.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022045350im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot_1_5557.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022045350im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot_2_6297.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022045350im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot_3_3888.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022045350im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot_4_5738.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022045350im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot_5_6583.png)
author: Will Miller

comments.content: You can get much better pictures from the site [http://www.precursorstudio.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022045350/http:/www.precursorstudio.com/). You select "Si Begg JNT1" or "Si Begg JNT2" on the left hand pannel and then answer "y" at the prompt at the bottom of the right hand pannel.

stephen, who puts out origin? is there a link to it?

w|m
I think Stephen was asking about the origin of your samples ;-)
Have you already taken a look at the [Identikal Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022045350/http:/www.identikalshop.com/font_search.php?searchTypeID=1&foundrySubSection=name)?

thanks for the link, yves. havent seen that one before..

w|m
